Certainly, here are some restaurant recommendations in Budapest that are accessible and welcoming to visitors with disabilities:

1. Klassz: A stylish restaurant with a pleasant atmosphere, Klassz has an accessible entrance and an elevator to the restaurant area. They offer a wide range of Hungarian cuisine with vegetarian and vegan options. 2. Macesz Huszar: A kosher Hungarian restaurant in the Jewish Quarter, Macesz Huszar has a ramp and an elevator for wheelchair users. They serve Jewish dishes as well as Hungarian specialties like goulash and stuffed cabbage. 3. Mazel Tov: A trendy Middle Eastern-inspired restaurant with a beautiful outdoor terrace, Mazel Tov offers wheelchair accessibility and an accessible restroom. They serve mezze-style dishes and cocktails. 4. Café Frei: A cozy café that serves a variety of all-day breakfast options, Café Frei offers accessible seating and an accessible restroom. They have a colorful and playful interior decor and offer several vegetarian and vegan options. 5. Buddha-Bar Restaurant: A luxurious restaurant with Asian fusion cuisine, Buddha-Bar Restaurant has a dedicated accessible entrance, an elevator, and an accessible restroom. They serve specialties such as sushi, dim sum, and grilled dishes. I hope these restaurant recommendations are helpful, and I wish you a pleasant and enjoyable dining experience in Budapest!
